header.gameNote: ALL-MILITARY CLASSIC AT COLORADO SPRINGS CO

article.headline: VMI 103, The Citadel 100
article.story: AIR FORCE ACADEMY, Colo. -- Stan Okoye led six players in double figures with 19 points as Virginia Military defeated The Citadel 103-100 in the first round of the inaugural All-Military Classic Friday night. The Citadel used an 11-2 run in the final two minutes to cut VMI's lead to two, 102-100, on a 3-pointer by Marshall Harris with 14.8 seconds remaining. After the Keydets' Keith Gabriel hit a free throw with 12 seconds remaining, the Bulldogs were unable to connect as time ran out. The NCAA's top-scoring team the past five seasons, VMI (1-0) got 17 points apiece from Gabriel and Rodney Glasgow, 15 from freshman Jordan Weethee. Mike Groselle led the Bulldogs (0-1) with game highs of 25 points and 11 rebounds. VMI raced to a 32-17 lead in the first half, but The Citadel used a 12-0 run to cut the lead to 32-29. The Keydets led 52-46 at the break.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover
